items.title: Christmas Day weather extremes across Australia
items.summary: Severe storms threaten Queensland, Melbourne will be cool and WA braces for extreme heat and bushfire warnings on Christmas Day.

items.title: Albanese government names groups it wants to crack down on amid anti-hate speech push
items.summary: The Albanese government has revealed two groups in its sights for allegedly promoting hate and disunity.

items.title: The simple Christmas food swaps that'll cut your grocery bill
items.summary: Some Australians are looking for ways to lower their grocery bills, as the cost of living continues to bite. Here are the top tips from experts.

items.title: Minns says protesters 'almost troll-like', unleashing 'forces they can't control'
items.summary: NSW Premier Chris Minns appeared to link the behaviour of some protesters to 'extreme actions' in the community.

items.title: Albanese recommends changes to MP travel perks following expenses controversy
items.summary: Families of politicians would have their flights downgraded to economy class if the recommendations are implemented.

items.title: 'A part of the US': Trump appoints Greenland envoy, sparking diplomatic backlash
items.summary: The US move revives sovereignty fears in the Arctic, as Denmark and Greenland warn strategic interests cannot justify territorial claims.

items.title: Ley stands by Wong criticism; Bowen calls Coalition words 'disgusting' amid Bondi debate
items.summary: As Sussan Ley stands by her attack on Penny Wong over the Bondi tragedy, Chris Bowen has condemned Ley's remarks as politically charged.

items.title: 'Retreating' or playing the long game: Have the Greens faded from the spotlight?
items.summary: In a sit-down with SBS News, Larissa Waters has admitted that while different from Adam Bandt, she's still fighting for the same values.

items.title: Russian general killed by car bomb in Moscow as Ukraine peace talks stall
items.summary: A string of Russian military figures and high-profile supporters of Moscow's war in Ukraine have been assassinated during the nearly four-year-old conflict.

items.title: As politicians debate a royal commission into the Bondi attack, what might it do?
items.summary: Political and community leaders joined calls for a royal commission in the wake of the Bondi terror attack, rejected by the prime minister.

items.title: 'It takes the pressure off': The upsides and challenges of being in a throuple
items.summary: While throuples are becoming more common and those in them say they can work, experts warn they can be tricky.

items.title: Albanese apologises over Bondi attack, as rules for visa cancellations revealed
items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said he felt the "weight of responsibility" for the attack.

items.title: Bondi gunmen used guns in countryside, conducted 'reconnaissance', police allege
items.summary: Court documents released to the media on Monday detail fresh allegations about the lead-up to the Bondi Beach terror attack.

items.title: 'Tinderbox' could set fire: Minns defends protest ban amid 'kneejerk' criticism
items.summary: Critics say the proposed reforms following the Bondi terror attack are "draconian" and "kneejerk anti-protest laws".

items.title: 'It started out as a joke': Why NRL star Mitch Kenny got into birdwatching
items.summary: The quiet pastime of birdwatching is taking flight online, linking enthusiasts beyond the outdoors.

items.title: From 'unashamedly political' to 'really steamy': 30 books to add to your summer reading list
items.summary: The powerful storytelling of culturally and linguistically diverse (CALD) writers is on full display in SBS' first summer reading guide.

items.title: Police charge man over alleged 'violent call to action' at beach
items.summary: The man has been charged with using a carriage service to menace, harass, offend and publicly threaten violence on grounds of race or religion.

items.title: What is collective grief? How Australians are mourning the Bondi attack together
items.summary: Following the Bondi Beach terror attack, people are coming together in Australia and around the world in grief.

items.title: Mandy thought she had a gastro bug. Three days later, she was in an induced coma
items.summary: For some people who have experienced life-threatening situations, it's not the situation itself that has the longest-lasting impact â€” it's the aftermath.

items.title: How the Bondi Beach terror attack could change protest laws
items.summary: NSW Premier Chris Minns says protests are "unleashing forces" organisers can't control, but critics say the proposals are an overreach.

items.title: 'Under-16 refugees': Will this platform see another new wave of users after the social media ban?
items.summary: With under-16s now excluded from many of their favourite social media apps, alternative platforms remain available, especially for bilingual teens.

items.title: Israel approves 19 new West Bank settlements aimed at 'blocking' a Palestinian state
items.summary: Israel said the 19 newly approved settlements are located in what it described as "highly strategic" areas.

items.title: US coast guard in 'pursuit' of another oil tanker near Venezuela
items.summary: The first oil tanker was seized by US forces on 10 December and a second one was "apprehended" on 20 December.

items.title: Nine killed, 10 injured in South Africa in second mass shooting this month
items.summary: South Africa, Africa's biggest economy, has one of the world's highest murder rates, averaging about 60 a day.
